questions.question_text: Which activity would BEST enable a risk manager to verify the scope of responsibilities for stakeholders in IT risk scenarios?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A tabletop exercise involves a structured discussion where stakeholders walk through the processes and actions they would take in various IT risk scenarios. This activity allows a risk manager to observe and verify the scope of responsibilities for each stakeholder in a controlled, realistic setting, ensuring everyone understands their roles and responsibilities.

Selected Answer: B
A Risk assessment will result in a risk owner which will clearly articulate boudaries of the risk. Tabletop conversations and interviews are very subjective in nature.

comments.content: Also the stakeholders might be outside IT, thus going with tabletop as you include more than just IT folks in them.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Going with A. Tabletop exercises do help identify who does what / responsibilities.
I am going with risk assessment B

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the BEST way to mitigate the risk of inappropriate access to personally identifiable information (PII) by third-party cloud service personnel?

choices.B: Ensure security clearance is in place within the third-party hiring process
choices.C: Choose a third-party provider in a jurisdiction with few privacy regulations
choices.D: Include data security requirements in the service level agreement (SLA)
choices.A: Utilize data encryption standards throughout the information life cycle
